description: This short trail in Kananaskis Country starts kind of steep through a forest which leads you to Elbow Lake and surrounding peaks. This trail is very popular with activity from mountain bikers, anglers, horseback riders etc.NTS Map: 082J11Elevation Gain: 150m (490 ft).
directions: From Hwy 1, turn off the Hwy 40 exit and head south for 61.8 km. Hang a left (east) into the Elbow Pass Day Use Area. You will see the trailhead in between the two parking lots. The trails goes up then right up a gravel road. The trail eventually levels off before you arrive at the lake.
title: Elbow Lake
